title: 109_hr100
content: The Act is titled the "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act." It allows for judicial review of orders of removal. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" allows for judicial review of orders of removal under Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act. Amendments include adding habeas corpus provisions from title 28, United States Code. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" allows for judicial review of orders of removal under Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act. Amendments include adding habeas corpus provisions from title 28, United States Code, and establishing the sole means for judicial review of claims under the United Nations Convention Against. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" establishes the exclusive means for judicial review of orders of removal under any provision of the Act, including habeas corpus review. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" limits judicial review of orders of removal, including habeas corpus review under section 2241 of title 28, United States Code, and other provisions of law. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" restricts judicial review of removal orders, including habeas corpus review under section 2241 of title 28, United States Code, and other provisions of law. The amendments made by the Act take effect immediately and apply to cases challenging final administrative removal orders. If a case is pending in a district court on the enactment date, it will be transferred to the court of appeals for review. The court of appeals will treat transferred lawyers as if it had been filed for review under section 242, with an exception for subsection (b)(1).
